body:
$! You can get funding for postgraduate study through studentships, bursaries, grants and loans - you might also be able to get help from your employer.$!

You can search for postgraduate funding on the [Scholarship Search](http://www.scholarship-search.org.uk/pls/mon/hc_edufin.page_pls_user_studmoney?x=16180339&y=&a=220707 "Scholarship Search"){:rel="external"} or [Prospects](http://www.prospects.ac.uk/search_funding_bodies.htm "Prospects"){:rel="external"} websites. 

##Studentships

These are postgraduate positions that have funding attached for fees, living expenses or both. They're mainly funded by the UK's Research Councils - the [Research Councils UK website](http://www.rcuk.ac.uk/researchcareers/postgrad/Pages/home.aspx "Research Councils UK website"){:rel="external"} has more information.

##Teacher training, social work, medical and healthcare courses

You can apply for funding for:

- [Initial Teacher Training](https://www.gov.uk/teacher-training-funding "Initial Teacher Training funding")
- social work - through a [social work bursary](https://www.gov.uk/social-work-bursaries#overview "social work bursary")
- some medical or healthcare courses - through an [NHS bursary](https://www.gov.uk/nhs-bursaries "nhs bursary")

##Charities and trusts

These sometimes provide grants, often for students from poorer backgrounds or those who've achieved academic excellence. You can find out more at your local library in these publications:

- the Educational Grants Directory
- the Charities Digest
- the Grants Register
- the Directory of Grant Making Trusts

You can also [search for educational grants](http://www.family-action.org.uk/section.aspx?id=1037 "search for educational grants"){:rel="external"} on the Family Action website.

###Learned societies

These sometimes offer funding for postgraduate or postdoctoral research. They include:

- the [British Academy](http://www.britac.ac.uk/ "British Academy"){:rel="external"} (for humanities and social sciences - postdoctorate only)
- the [Royal Academy of Engineering](http://www.raeng.org.uk/ "Royal Academy of Engineering"){:rel="external"} (for engineering)
- the [Royal Society](http://royalsociety.org/ "Royal Society"){:rel="external"} (for science - postdoctorate only)

###Other forms of help

You might also be able to get funding from:

- an individual - sometimes people donate awards to help postgraduates (these are usually offered through your university or college)
- [your employer](https://www.gov.uk/training-study-work-your-rights "training and study at work") - they might sponsor you if the course is relevant to your job
- a [Disabled Students' Allowance](https://www.gov.uk/disabled-students-allowances-dsas "Disabled Students' Allownace") 
- a [Professional and Career Development Loan](https://www.gov.uk/career-development-loans/overview "Career Development Loan")
- the [Student Awards Agency for Scotland](http://www.saas.gov.uk/ "Student Awards Agency for Scotland"){:rel="external"} if you're from Scotland

^Funding applications usually have to be in by the spring before you start studying in the autumn.^
overview: Information about different types of postgraduate funding available - scholarships, bursaries, grants and loans and where to apply
title: Funding for postgraduate study
